episodes.title: Triple J - Revival Centres International: A cult church (part 2)
episodes.description:
Triple J's Sarah McDonald interviews Troy Waller regarding the cult / sect fundamentalist 'Christian' church group "Revival Centres International". Affiliate churches include The Revival Fellowship, The Geelong Revival Centre, and CAI: Christian assemblies International.

Callers respond, including a member of the Revival church.

See the false prophesies of this cult exposed at
http://revivalprophecy.blogspot.com/

The full updated version of this interview can be found at
http://revivalvideos.blogspot.com/

For more information on the Revival Churches visit:
http://revival.aimoo.com

episodes.title: Triple J Interview - Revival Centres International: CULT (part 1 of 4))
episodes.description:
Triple J's Sarah McDonald interviews Troy Waller regarding the cult / sect fundamentalist 'Christian' church group "Revival Centres International".  Affiliated include "The Revival Fellowship", "Geelong Revival Centres", and also "Christian Assemblies International".

On 3 June, 1998 at 11AM on Triple J, there was a long discussion and even some talk-back callers. Troy Waller was interviewed about his deconversion from the Revival Centres International cult. He describes the workings of the organisation and how to best help those who are stuck in its control or are trying to leave or have left.

Triple J opened the lines to hear from people who had a history with the organisation or were still involved with it. One particular caller describes how it felt to be a gay man trying to deal with the oppression of Revival homophobia.

The following media is part one of four parts

See the false prophesies of this cult exposed at
http://revivalprophecy.blogspot.com/

The full updated version of this interview can be found at
http://revivalvideos.blogspot.com/

For more information on the Revival Churches visit:
http://revival.aimoo.com

episodes.title: Noel Hollins of 'Geelong Revival Centres' cult
episodes.description:
Hendersons in hiding from GRC church. Today/Tonight follow up story. Noel Hollins' 'church' is exposed as having many cult characteristics after ex-communicating Taylor Henderson of 'Australia's Got Talent' fame from its flock for participating in the competition. Interviews with ex-members detail the self-titled 'Christian' church's ties to British Israelism, and spiritual supremacy over other churches.

The full updated version of this interview can be found at
http://revivalvideos.blogspot.com/

For more information on the Revival Churches visit:
http://revival.aimoo.com
